How many pairs of "consecutive pairs" can be created from the data?<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:Where do you buy tickets at a ticket booth for games/ Choices:  A: train station B: cathedral C: metro station D: fairgrounds E: amusement park<n>Output:		The answer is A, because A is the only choice that is not a place to buy tickets.<n><n> Input:Choices:  A: atm B: library C: bank D: phone booth<n>Output: The answer to where to get free money is C, because C is the only choice that lists a bank as one of its locations.<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:If somebody likes temperatures cool, they might have more than one electric fan where? Choices:  A: home B: hardware store C: home D: hot room E: office<n>Output:		It is more practical to put more than one electric fan in the home.<n>So the answer is A: "home"<n><n><n><n>Input: Two trains departing from the same station run parallel for two hours. Then one of them turns to run 40 mph in the same direction, while the other continues at 50 mph, how far apart after three hours?<n>Output: If you run parallel for two hours then turn at 40 mph, the other continues to run at 50 m/h the distance apart after three hours is 53 m/h - 40 m/h = <<53-40=13>>13 m.<n>If you run parallel for two hour then turn at 45 m/h, the other continues to at 55 m/h the distance after three hours is 40 m/c - 45 m/c = <<40-45= -5>>-5 m.<n>So the final distance apart after three hours for running parallel for two hours then turning in the same direction is 13 m.<n><n>

He was a bit upset that he had to do it, but he needed the job.  Still, he would have preferred it if the job were what? Choices:  A: present B: stay here C: closer D: available E: come here<n>Output:		Present: <<Present>>Present is far away. It is a synonym of distant since the present is what is happening right now.<n>Stay here: <<Stay here>>Stay here means to stay in the same place. <n>Closer: <<Closer>>Closer means nearer.<n>Come here: <<Come here>>Come here also means a synonym of come nearer since it means to come to this place.<n><n><n>## 2:<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the questions that best fits the given instructions.<n><n><n>### 2.1:<n><n>input: Jane got 81% of her total grade last semester and an A on her 10 math test. Her total grade was 97%. How many grades were there last semester?<n>output:There were 11 tests last semester since she got an A on each of them.  And 81% of 11 is 9. Therefore, she got 97/9 = <<97/9=11>>11 grade last semester.  And each 11 grade is equal to 11x100=. <n>So the final answer should be<n>220<n>since she got an A on 10 tests and her total grade was 220/2 = <220/2=110>> 110.<n><n>### 3.1:<n><n>Input: A group of students is given 50 marbles. If 12 boys and 16 girls are equally divided among them, how many girls were in the group?<n>Output:The 3 groups:1) boys, 2) girls, and 3) rest, are equal sizes if each group is given an equal number of marbles.<n>Therefore, if each group is given 5/13 = <<5/13=0.38>>0.38 of the initial number of marbles, their sizes must be equal.<n>So each group has 50/0.38 = <<50/0.42>>42.61623 marbles.  And each of the boys group have 5/12 = <<5/12=4.16666667>>4.1667.<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. Choices:  A: brown hair B: names C: two eyes D: will E: brains<n>Output:		The choices are <<names, eyes, hair, brains>>B: Names have the same length, the same shapes and the same order. These are shared by two or more people in a family. Therefore, people in the same family frequently share names.<n>So the final Answer is A.<n><n>Input: Which of these numbers is even greater than 200 and is also greater than 32? Choices: A: 300 B: 400 C: 500 D: 600 E: 700<n>Output: The choices for the question are <<300, 400, 500, 600>>B:400 > 200 and 200 > 32 so 400 is even greater than 32 and is even greater than 400. So the correct answer is (B)<n><n><n>Input: Choose the correct comparison:<<10 + 60 = 70>>2 = <<10+60=70>><n>Which is greater: A. 2 + 7 = 9 B. 5 + 10 = 15<n>Output: The choices answer are<<2+7=9>>A, <<5+10=15>>B<n><n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:James chose to not to print the cards, because he wanted to be more personal. What type of cards did he choose, instead? Choices:  A: cursive writing B: hand writing C: store bought D: online media E: hand written<n>Output:		Answer: D<n><n>Input: Jane and her brother were walking to town. How many children did she have?<n>Output: 5 + 3 - 43 = <<5+3-43=1>>1 Children<n>So the final answer was 1 Children<n><n>Input: Is the quotient in the equation \(114/14\) the same as the quotient in the \(122/19\) quotient? Yes \/ No<n>Output:Answer: No<n><n>Input: Is \(30 + 30\) the same as \(2 x 20\)<n>Output: 30 + 32 = <<30+32=62>>62<n><n>50 + <50> = <<50+50=50>>5 <n><n>Input: How many 20’s are in 100?<n>Output: 20<n><n>Input: How would \(1505 \%\) and \(350 \%\) of 50% be added?<n>Output:55% is 27.5% of 2 of 100%<n><n>Input:If \(444 x 45\) = 20,120 what is the product of 445 x 45?<n>Output:444 + 1 = <<444+1=445>>445<n><n>Input: 1000 divided by 0.4 = 2,500<n><n>8 divided by 0.3 = 26<n><n><n>

Program to calculate the area of a figure composed of a circle, a square, and a rectangle. You are to compute the area of the figure.<n><n>Example 2. Program to calculate the volume of a figure composed of four polygons with variable number of sides. You are to compute its volume.<n><n>Input: A triangle with sides 3, 4, and 5<n><n>Output: <<3, 4, 5>>3, 4, & 5.<n><n>Input: Input a triangle with sides a, b and c<n><n><n>Output: <<a, b, c>>a, b, & c.<n><n>```<n>    /* The main method of the program */<n>    public static void main(String[] args){<n>            /* Area of a triangle */<n>         double a, b, c;<n>         a = 3.0;<n>         b = 4.0;<n>         c = 5.0;<n>            double area = a + b + c;<n>            double area1=a;<n>               System.out.println(area);<n>}<n>    /* Volume of trapezoid */<n>public static void volTrapezoid(double a,double b,double c,double d){<n>   System.out.println("Volume of trapezoid ="+a+b+c+d);<n>}<n>    public static void volRectangle(double a,double h,double w){<n>   System.printf("Volume of rectangule ="+a+h+w);<n>}<n>    } <n>    }<n>```<n>Output: 6.<n><n>### A question:<n>What is a main method of a method program?<n><n>Answer: Main() method is used to initiate and organize the activity within the method program. All subroutines, procedures, and functions within a program must go through the main() method, the top portion of the program, the program header, which provides information about the program

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:The person was looking up airline and hotel prices, what was he looking to do? How many couples are there in a house?<n>Output: There are six women in the house, so three women are left out of the calculation.<n>Next, we know that every pair shares the same number of children, which reduces the number of children by two (the sum of the pairs).<n>So there are 3 women with 3 children left, and 3 women with 4 children.<n>And since 1 woman = 5 women, there are 2 couples in total.<n><n>Input:The sum of numbers 1 … 10 will be 55. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:Where does a spoon go on one side of a plate? Choices:  A: bowl of soup B: serving dish C: table setting D: placemat E: glass of iced tea<n>Output:		The answer is C (table setting). You do not put a spoon on the same side of a plate that someone is using a fork.<n><n>Input:What goes around the moon but  doesn’t go around the Earth? Choices: 	B: Sun C: Planet D: Star E: Lunar eclipse F: Solar eclipse<n>Output: The correct answer is E: Lunar eclipses happen when the shadow of the Earth falls on to the moon. Solar eclipses occur when the Moon moves between the Sun and the earth.<n>

If you multiply two numbers, the result is divisible by 3 if the factors of the result are also divisible by 3. So, 35 × 2 = 70 is divisible by 9 because 9 divides 70 with no remainder. Multiply -35 by a negative number to get the opposite. So, if you multiply the number by negative 2, you get the answer to subtract. The answer is negative 35. So, the result of 35 × 4 is - 35 - 4 = negative 48. So if you add 5, you get 0.<n><n>Output:(35 × 4) - 5 = negative 48<n><n>Input: A computer program needs a data type so it can display a user's first name. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:What is a place that might not always have a queen? Choices:  A: bee hive B: england C: castle D: deck of cards E: chess game<n>Output:		The answer is E. Since, a queen is never inside of the chess game, it will not have a queen.<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:What does someone want when having fun with their friends and trying to fit in? If the first unit test is worth 20% of the final grade, what grade will the student receive in the class? Choice:A) B) C) D)<n>Output: The student will get a B, 0.85(first) + 0.95(second) = 0.99, The grade will be rounded to A, 99% -> 99 rounded to an A.<n><n><n>Input: If Ann buys 64 packages of chocolate and each package is 0.75 kg. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:The other passengers on the bus were quite loud, so he put on his headphones to relax and what? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:In the movie a fragile man is causing accidents, his hope is to find a person opposite of him who is what? What is the length of a runway when the average speed of the plane is 9 mph? <n>A. 400 miles <n>B. 350 miles <n>C. 300 miles <n>D. 285 miles <n>E. 210 miles<n><n>Answer: The length of a runway = 9/5 of plane's speed<n>=> 800/9/5 = 210 miles
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:It was a vast complex, the launch pad was just one part of what? Choices:  A: movie B: cape kennedy C: space center D: military installation E: spaceship centre<n>Output:		The correct answer is c "A ← movie"<n><n>We are given a complex. Complex means involving many things, so involving many different aspects to it. The launch pad is just one part of all the things involved. It is only a one piece in many pieces that make up an entire area. So we just need one piece that makes up the entire area. This is the correct answer. This will help us to find the answer for the next question.

If you are uncertain about the truthfulness of a statement, you can test this by asking yourself, if this is True, then? If the conditional is True and you are still unsure about the main statement, choose the other side. If the conditional is True but the main statement is False, the conditional is true. If the conditional is False, the conditional must be False. Choose the answer which is the inverse of the other three answers.<n>Output:-1<n><n>Input:The conditional “if it is true, then I go to the park.” is:<n>Output: If it is true that you go to the park.

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:Where can you store you tent and keep it on your person? Choices:  A: sleep in while camping B: camp ground C: woods D: bag E: backpack<n>Output:		If you keep it in a bag, it is F on B, and the tent will go into the bag.<n>Now you know a sleeping bag can be used to store a tent.<n><n>Input: Which of the following statements cannot be considered as true by the average educated person? A: I read about this in the newspaper. B: I know the people from other countries. C: I visited their capitol. D: It is very far and expensive to travel by plane. E: I will never go anywhere that way.<n>Output: Every true statement is a fact.<n>Therefore, only option C is false because “it is very far and expensive ” is not a fact.<n><n>Input: What is two plus five?<n>Output: 5+5=<<5+5=10>>10<n><n>Input: There are 3 sheep, 2 goats, and 12 chicken on the farm, and no pigs.  If a chicken costs 13 dollars, what do the sheep and goats cost?<n>Output: First, find the cost of 13 sheep.  To do this, first, find the number representing sheep, which is 10 (13 sheep = 10 sheep and 3 are left) and to multiply 13 times 10 to find the cost, the answer is <<13*10=130>>130 dollars.<n>Now find the number representing goats, which is 3 (1 goat + 2 goats = 3 goats + 2 goats left). The cost of goats are <<130/3=<<130/3==$43>>$43>>$23 dollars each (notice that 130/3 means “3rd root of 130”) and multiply 2 to find the cost of sheep and goats, the answer is 23+23 = 46 dollars.<n><n>Now, find the cost of the chicken, which is 2 (the same chicken as the goats).<n>Again, find the number representing chicken, which is the number 13 from above (The cost of chicken was the same as the cost of sheep.)<n>So, the cost of chicken is <<13*2=<<13*2=26>>$26>>$2 dollars

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:Why might a person go to get counseling? Choices:  A: to be heard B: receive gifts C: understand themselves D: good things in life E: acknowledgment<n>Output:		A :  A: to be herd B: receive gifts  C: understand themselves D : good things in life  E: acknowledgment<n><n><n>```Python<n>def gcd(x, y) :<n>    if(x > y):<n>        x, y = y,x<n>print( gcd(1768,20) )<n>```<n><n>#### Instruction:Answer the multiple choice questions.<n><n>Input: Why might a bank robbery succeed? Choices: A: The police are not on the job B: The victims are in a hurry C: Nobody gets hurt D: It is easy to pull off E: Nothing is gained.<n>Output: A: The police aren't on the job B: Nobody gets hurt C:  Nobody gets killed D:  It is easy to pull of E: Nothing is gained<n>```python<n>def getScore(student_id,score) :<n>    if type(student_id) == int and type(score) == int and student_id >= 0 and score >= 0:<n>        total = score + student_id<n>        return total<n>    else :<n>        print("Invalid input data")<n>```<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:What might someone do who is having fun? Choices:  A: being happy B: glee C: smoke D: stress relief E: may laugh<n>Output:		If you picked:B: Glee or A: Happy (that is, if you're having fun.) then you made the correct choice.<n><n>Input: If x = 4,  (x - 4)(x + 1) =?<n>Output: x = 4 has no inverse (x + 1).<n><n>Input:  A: It was too dark to use his cell phone. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:The old barn was beyond repair, they had to destroy it before they could what a new one? Choices:  A: make B: raise C: entice D: build E: fix<n>Output:		The phrase "destroy it" means"tear it down" which is not an option. "Raise it" means build a taller building on top of the old one. "Encite" means call the city to fix it, but it needs much more to fix it than just having people work with shovels. "Build" is the only option out of the choices that means the same thing as the entire sentence. (The old barn was destroyed so that another one could be built).<n>Therefore,  the answer is B.<n><n><n>Input: What number comes next in the sequence 14, 22, 34, 46,...., 717?<n>Output: 8274240<n>The first 2 digits are 82, then add 8 to the numbers that comes after, and they are the ones of the sequence. The 3rd and 4th digits are 74, then add 7 and 7 to the numbers that comes up after, and they are also of the sequence. The rest numbers are 240, but 2*40 = 80, so just add that number to 240 since you have to add 8 to those numbers. So, the answer is 88899100<n><n><n>Input: A 2012 model of a car gets 30 miles per gallon of fuel, a 2013 model gets 31 mpg, a 2001 model gets 17 mpg, a 1967 model gets 8 mpg, and a 1957 model gets 4 miles per gallon. Which model gets the most miles per gallon?<n>Output: The 2013 car gets more miles per gallon than the old cars. It is 31 - 17 = <<31-17= 14>>14.<n>Then, 17-8 = <<17-8=9>>9 and 9-4 = <<9-4=5>>5.<n>The current one gets more miles per gallons than the old ones, therefore the 2013 one has the most. <n><n>Input: What is the average (arithmetic mean) of the integers from 8 to 199?<n>Output: The average

Which of the following numbers (if any) is NOT a possible value for this average distance? Choices: A: 31/2 mi/h B: 31/8 mi/h C: 8/15 mi/h D: 17/16 mi/h<n>Output:<<D: 17/8>>17/8 is not between.<n>In this problem, in the United States, the average distance from two points would be between 20 mi / h ( 20 × 1/2 = 10 mi / h) and 40 mi / h (40 × 1/4 = 10 mi/h).<n><n>Input: The product of the digits at a base of 2 (which is divisible by 2) is equal to 2. Which of the following could NOT be the product of three consecutive digits in base 2?<n>Output: <<8:110>>10, 110 is divisible by 10.<n>8:110 would not be divisible by 2.<n>The base 2 of 10 has 110 = 102 = 100 + 10 + 0.<n>The base of 110 has 10110 = 97 + 37 + (1 * 0).<n><n>Input: 1. What is the value in the equation: 1/2 × 4/5 =? A: 1/3 B: 1/4 C: 2/3 D: 2/5 E: 4/3<n>Output: <D: 2/5> Dividing 1/3 by 4/5 gives 0.16, while dividing by 2/5 gives 0,<n>(1/3) / (4/5)<n>1/3 = 0.266... = 0.27...<n>(2/3) / (2/5)<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:If you're betting with a shark, where are you likely playing? Choices:  A: aquarium B: mediterranean sea C: south pacific D: pool hall E: pacific ocean<n>Output:		The answer is B. The Shark is an aquatic mammal (Mediterranean Sea), so you're better off playing on the beach.<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:HOw do you carry potatos home? Choices:  A: grocery store B: grocery bag C: restaurants D: farmer's market E: bushel basket<n>Output:		You can use A, B, C, or D. A, B, C refer to grocery items and D refers to farmer's market.<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>```python<n>import numpy as np<n><n>n=1<n><n>##Question 1<n>inputs=raw_input()<n>if inputs.strip()=="Answer the following multiple choice questions":<n>	print("true")<n>elif inputs.strip()=="Janet has 9 cards than Brenda. Maru":<n>	cards=int(inputs.strip())<n>	brenda=int(inputs2.strip())<n>	if cards>150 and brenda>150:<n>		ans=cards+brenda+cards-brenda*2<n>		print("answer: "+ ans)<n>	else:<n>		if (cards>brenda):<n>			cards=cards-brenda<n>			if cards<=150:<n><n>				while cards<150:<n> 					cards= cards+1<n>					print("answer:"+cards)<n>				print ("answer:",cards)<n>		else:<n><n>		    brenda=brenda-cards<n>		    if brenda<=150: <n>			while brenda<150: 			<n>				brenda=brenda+1<n>		        print ("answer:",brenda)<n>			print("Annswer: ",brenda+cards)<n>	<n><n>##querstion 2<n>inputs=raw.input()<n>if inputs=="":<n>	print(10)<n>elif inputs.strip().split()==["5 blocks", "bus garage", "post office", "50", "home"]:<n>        print("true")<n>else:<n>    print("false")<n><n><n>inputs=raw_.input()<n>if int(inputs.replace(" ", ""))>=0:<n>    print("1")<n>elif inputs>=0:<n>    ans=0<n>    <n>    while inputs >=0:<n>        ans = ans + 1<n>        inputs = inputs - 1<n>        print('answer is',ans)<n>        <n>    <n>```<n><n>#### Comment: I am sure there is
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:Where do almost all people live? Choices:  A: football stadium B: apartment C: surface of earth D: car show E: house<n>Output:		Almost all people live in E: <<E>>house.<n><<House>><<1>> 75%<n><<A>><<2>> 15%<n><<B>><<3>> 10%<n><<D>><<4>> 0%<n><<E>><<5>> 0%<n>Because the question asks "almost all people" the answer is 75% of <<5>>75%<n>So the final answer E: house<n><n>This solution needs explanation.<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:Where would I put a rosebush if I did not have any containers to store it in? Choices:  A: flower garden B: garden center C: pot D: pot E: formal garden<n>Output:		Place the rosebush in the same place that it is currently growing if I did not have a container to store it in.<n><n>Input: I want to find my weight if I weigh myself 5 time as soon as I get up. Find the answer.<n>Output: I would have to weigh myself 5 times as soon as I get out of bed.<n>This would take me to weight myself 5 + 5 times = <<5+5=10>>10 times in all.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:Where in a town would you put your shed? Choices:  A: next to the house B: keeping things in C: backyard D: farm yard E: ranch<n>Output:		A is adjacent to the house.<n>B is at the back.<n>C is the backyard.<n>D puts things next to the property.<n>E puts things near the farm.<n>So shed will go at the back of the house and the shed's location is backyard. There fore the final answer is B.<n><n><n>Input: A school bus holds 72 students and has 12 seats. How many kids can the bus carry?<n>Output: We have 60/11 = <<60/11=5.45>>5.45 seats with 72 students.<n>So the number of seats is <5.45> and the final answer is 60<n><n>Input: 42-23 = <<42-23=19>>19.<n><n>Input: 55455 - 204 = <<55455-204=53411>>53411.<n><n>Input: How many times does 36 go into 40?<n><n>Output: The factor 6 in the expression 12 × 6 = <<12*6=72>>72 goes into 40 6 times.<n>So the answer is 6.<n><n>Input: A square of side-length 13 units is inscribed in a semicircle, which has a radius of 8 units. What is the area of the square?<n>Output: 3 × 82 = <<3*82=24>>24 square units is inscribed(small square inside the big circle).<n>The diameter of the semicircle is 8 + 8 = 16. <n>Therefore, 132 + 162 = 316 is equal to 132, so area of a circle is given by A=πr2=3.1416.<n>So the square is made up of 4 triangles with side length 4 units, area of a triangle is given by A=1/2bh=4/2(13)(8)=24.<n>So area of square is given by A=3.14∗√2(24). So the answer is 24<n><n>Input: If the area of a rectangle is 750 square meters
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. (You can also find D in New Mexico, at the Denver Zoo.)<n><n>Input:A: 60, B: 50, C: 40, D: 30<n>Output: C is correct. If we add 40 and 30, we get 70. Then add 70 and subtract B, we get 130. Finally add 130 and A, and we get 60. Therefore, A is correct.<n><n>Input: A: 60, C: 50, D: 40<n>Output: The correct answer is C. In this format, the answer is "no".<n>The toy for 3 cents is "yes"<n>In this format, the answer to the question is "yes".<n>So final answer is "yes"<n><n>Input:   Which is the most popular sport?<n>Answer:  Football is the most popular sport.<n><n>Input:  What are the two longest rivers in Russia?<n>Answer:  The Lena River and the Volga River are the longest in Russia.<n><n>Input: Which is the most popular food in Thailand?<n>Answer: The most popular food in South Thailand is "Fried Chicken" and "Spaghetti".<n><n>Input:What are the two tallest mountains in the United States?<n>Answer: The Mount Everest and the Mount Kilimanjaro are two high mountains in the United States.<n><n>Input: I like pizza.<n>Answer: <<I LIKE PIZZA>>Yes.<n><n>Input: What is the longest river in the world?<n>Answer: The Nile river is the longest river in our world.<n><n>Input:What is the biggest in the world?<n>>>What is the biggest is the moon.<n><n>Input:How long is the earth's equator?<n>Answer: The equator is 40,000 kilometers long.<n><n>Input:I like apples.<n>Answer: <<yes.>><n><n>Input:What kind of animals live on the moon?<n>Answer: There are no animals on the
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:Where do most people keep their curling iron stored? Choices:  A: bathroom B: walkway C: use D: hair salon E: drawer<n>Output:		The most common answer is A.<n><n>### Instruction: Input: Which would get you there quicker: a taxi or a bus? Choices: 1) A: taxi 2) B: bus<n>Input: Which airplane would you prefer: A: jet or B: propeller?<n>Input: Would you rather watch an action movie or a drama? Choices: A: action movie 2) B: drama<n>Input: Would you prefer getting your hair done at a hair salon or on your own at home?<n>A: Hair salon<n>B: Do on your own at home<n>C: Hair salon is more expensive<n>D: I do not trust hairstylists<n>Input: Do you rather sit through a boring movie or a movie you like but is too long?<n>A: Sit through a boring movie<n>B: Movie I like is too long<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following questions. There is no negative or positive question, choose only A or B.<n>The answers to these questions can provide insight into the questioner's preference.<n><n>*** What do you need a laptop for?<n><n>#### Choices:  A. I need it for schoolwork only<n><n>B. I need it for work and school<n>*** What are you looking for in a computer?<n><n>Choices:  A. To work on Power point<n><n>B. To browse online and check e-mail<n><n>#### What would you like to travel to this summer?<n>Choices:  a. Mexico City<n>b. California<n><n>c. The Grand Canyon<n>d. Europe<n>e. Chicago<n>Input: What do you think about the new Star Wars movie? Choices: A 1: Love it B 2: Like it<n><n>#### What do you prefer: A: eating out often<n>B: Cooking at home<n>Input: What do your parents think about you getting a pet? Choices: A. Your parents will welcome a pet<n><n>B. Your parents would prefer a pet<n>Input: Are you going out tonight? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:What does a master carpenter use to put holes in objects? Choices:  A: drill B: learn C: require obedience D: understand E: spoon<n>Output:		In order to put a hole in an object, the carpenter must (A) drill into the object or (B) learn how to drill into the object.  <n>Therefore, the correct answer is D spoon.<n><n>Input: A number cube is rolled 2 times. The sum is equal to 11 what is the probability it rolled an even number?<n>Output: The probability of an even number is ½(1/2 × 2) = <<½*(1/2*2)=1/4>>, or 0.25.  <n>Therefore the final answer is 0.25<n><n>Input: A letter is thrown into a mailbox and then back into the box, and again, and again 500 times. What is the probability of getting a letter with a lower case letter?<n>Output: The only two types of letters are upper and lower case. One of these letters must be chosen as a result of each throw. Therefore, we need to multiply the probabilities of getting an ‘a’ and getting an ‘e.’ Thus the answer is 500 * 4/8 = <<4/8>> = 1/2. Therefore the final answer is 1/2<n><n>Input: The sum of a numbers is 12 and double of the number is 56.<n>Output: Let n = 56 – 12 = 44. 12 = 6(n/2) + 2. The values of n that satisfy 44 = n × 2 are {3, 2, 1, 0}.  <n>Since 12 is odd, 2 must be the correct choice. Therefore the final answer (and its explanation) 2<n><n>Input: A 2 digit number, whose ones digit is the reverse of the tens digit.<n>Output:  The ones digit is the reverse, or (1/2 – 1/2) = 0 or 1.<n>The tens digit is simply (100 digits + the ones digit) = 10 + 0 or 10 + 1 = tens digits<n>The given 2-digit number is: 10 + 30 = 40<n>56 is the answer<n><n>Input: In a game of 21, every time the value on roll of a die matches the 2 card that’

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:Danny was having fun singing in front of his class.   He has a lot of what? Choices:  A: laughter B: being happy C: glee D: opera E: injuries<n>Output:		Since Danny was happy, the correct answer is B. Therefore, the correct answer is being happy.<n><n>Input: A: The number 216 written as a product is 2 × 2 × 13.  B: The number 233 written in standard form is 32 × 7. C: An integer greater than 4 is divisible by 7. D: The absolute value of the number 45 is 45.<n><n>Output: Choice D. This is the only one with an absolute value that is an integer and thus not a multiple of 6. Thus, the final correct answer is 45. To find the answer, look for possible choices which are products, but not standard forms.<n><n>Input: What is 5 × 516 = <<5616>>5616?<n>Output: The answer is in base 8. Thus, the correct answer is 4096<n><n>Input: For his 2nd birthday party, Tim asked 300 guests.  There were 300 candles on the cake.  Tim's mother forgot to bring napkins. She purchased 375 of them<n>Output: You must subtract the candles from the guests because you don't want any napkins left over<n>Candidates:  The birthday cake has 300 candle-sticks and 300 guests, so there are as many as possible candles and napkins for each guest<n>Napkins required: [[375x(2/3)]+1] = 104<n>Required candle<n>[[(251x(2/31)]+2 ] = (26x(8/10] = (143<n>Candidate<n>Required napkins and candles<n>[[252x(2/331)+1]][142x(8/11)]] = [84+[1276x(16/4196)]][(27x131)<n>The last part is the answer in its lowest possible representation.<n>Answers that come from this part are often multiples of large numbers, so they may contain a large factor.  You can divide the last part of the answer, multiply it by 101119

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:What do humans take in while breathing? Choices:  A: lungs and diaphram B: oxygen C: abdominal muscles D: air E: open throat<n>Output:		The answer is B<<B=OXYGEN>>OXYGEN.<n><n>Input: A person lives a day at 200 miles from her home. After the next day at the same place, she drives 100 miles back to her home. How far does she drive in all?<n>Output:\[\]A person drives 200+100+10  = <<200+110+10=320>>320 miles.<n><n>**Output:**<n><n><n><n>Input: John left town in a car and drove to the coast 400 miles from his house. Then he continued his drive in a truck and went 200 miles more. How far is John from home?<n>Output:\[\]= <<400/=200>>200 miles<n><n>#### Program 2<n>Given input, choose True if it’s true, False otherwise.<n><n>Input: Is it true that more than 50% of humans in the world speak English?<n>Output: <<Yes>>Yes.<n><n>Input: Can humans talk?<n>Output: <<No>>No.<n><n>Input: Did Jared and Liz get the job?<n>Output: <<Not known>>Not known<n><n>Input: Are all dogs canines?<n>Output: <<True>>True.<n><n>Input: Are the cars moving?<n>Output: <<False>>False<n><n>Input: Is there cake on the table?<n>Output: <<Unknown>>Unknown<n><n>Input: Can you eat cheese?<n>Output: <<Are you vegetarian?>>Yes or No<n><n>### Problem 4<n><n>Given an array, find out whether it is a rotation of another array.<n><n>#### Program 3<n>An array can be rotated by 90 degree if 3 conditions are met.<n>1.The first and last element are same.<n>2.The middle element is a max.<n>3.Every elements less than the max of the middle element are before.<n><n>Input:<n><n>A=[[75,83,70,80,27,79]<n><n>Output:<<True>>True<n><n>Input:<n>A=[[70,45,70,28,40,70]<n>Output:<<True]]True<n>Input<n>A=[[1,5
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:Where is a lion likely to live? Choices:  A: veldt B: ocean C: savannah D: africa E: jungle<n>Output:		The answer is D A lion is found only in AFRICA.

Eggs b) Rice c) Corn<n>Output: The correct answer is B. The New York Yankees, one of the MLB teams, is the highest-grosing sports franchise in US
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:Dry and cracked heels are found on? How much shortening does a box of cake mix contain?<n>Output: There are <<2+5=7>>7 cups of batter.<n>2 cups of butt = <<2 cups of butting=1/5>>1/5 of a cup.<n>5 cups butter = <<5cups of butter=1>> a cup.<n>The box contains <<1/5+1>>1/5 + 1 cups of butter shortening.<n>This can mean either that 1/5 + 5/1 or that 7/20 + 1/5 + or 5/20 + 0/5.<n>The correct answer is <<5/20=2>>2 cups of shortening.<n><n>### End of file.<n>------------------------------------------------------------------------------<n>'''<n>#!/usr/bin/python<n># -*- coding: utf-8 -*-<n>'''<n>### Problem Code:2<n>### Instruction: Answer the following two-choice questions.<n><n>### Instruction1:<n><n>### Instuction2:<n><n>Output: <<0>> 0 = 6<n><n>Input: What happens if we add 1 and 6? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:Reading a newspaper gives you a what about local current events? Choices:  Not good well not too good really well really<n>Output:  Really
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:I'm watching tv because there is nothing else to do, what do I expect to get from this? Choices:  A: book B: meeting C: television D: guide E: newspaper<n>Output:		Choice: <<C>>C-television<n>Choice: <<D>>D-newspaper<n>Choice: <<E>>E-all of the above<n>Choice: <<B>>B-meeting<n><n>If the answer is Choice E, the statement is incorrect.<n>Then the correct answer should be Choice B.<n>Choice A is incorrect because the answer is Choice B.<n>If the answer is incorrect then the options are Choice A-B.<n>Choice A-B <n>If the answer is correct then the options are Choose C or E.<n>Then the answer choices are A-B-C-E.<n>So the final statement is A-B-C.<n><n>Output:  I: All states have a capital city.  II: Most states have capitals located in the most populous city.  III: Most states have capitols located at a major road junction within their state.<n><n>Statement II is incorrect because the answer choice is <<D>>D-the most populous city<n>Statement III is incorrect because the answer choices are<<A>>A-Major road junction<n><n>Statement I is false because: Choices:  A. New York State has the most counties - 62 B. Maryland is called the Old Line State, and it is also called the Old Line State - 1<n><n>If it is not true, then it should be <<false>>.<n>In the answer choices, there is no state with all cities.<n>The statement is true since there is a state in the answer choices that has all of its capitals.<n>Therefore, the statements are <<I>>I-true and <<III>>III-true.<n>Statement I should be <<I>>I-True.<n>If Statement 1 is false, only Statement 1 can be false.<n>Therefore, only Statement 2 can be true.<n>Then Statement 1 and Statement 2 are both false.<n>So the statement is true since there are two statements in the answer choices that are false. <n><n>### Instruction:Find the odd man out.<n><n>Input: A:1-3-9 B:2-4-5 C:4-5-9 D:5-9-2 E:6-5-1<n>Output:A: 1-3-9<n>The answer is Choice A 1-3-5-
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:Lizards need the sun's heat to regulate their body temperature, this is why you'll see them still on what? Choices:  A: bushes B: dessert C: books D: heat lamps E: rocks<n>Output:		Lizards like to lie on rocks because they absorb the sun's heat directly. Lizards like to lay on a sunny rock since rocks absorb the sun'sun heat. Lizards like rocks because they absorb all the suns rays which keep the lizards bodies warm. So the final answer is A: rocks<n><n>Input: Choose 5 integers between 1 and 10 to make a magic 5-number cube.<n>Output: For a magic 5-cube, the first number is an odd number.The total of all the other numbers has to be an odd number.The sum of all the other numbers needs to be less than the first number.So,for a magic 5-figure cube, the first number can be 5 or 9 and each of the other numbers has to add up to less than the first number, or the first number has to add up to any number less than the first number and all of the other numbers has tot be < 5,9 for the total of all the other number to be odd and for the magic cube formula to be used. Since magic 5-figure cubes have both an odd number and a 3-number combination between the 5-cube numbers and odd(<5,9) or odd(<6,10), it isn't obvious how many possible solutions there are. However, there are 10!/(2!*8!) or about 194 different 5-figure cubed numbers. <n> <n> <n>**Input:** 3,4,7,2,3  <n><n>**Output:** 7<3<4<2<5<n>**Note:** The first character in a line could be any of '\n','','\t'.  <n>

Input: Janet has 8 cards more than Brenda; Brenda has only 5 fewer cards than Mara. Mara has 16 more than Janet. How many card do they have in all?<n>```<n>Solution1: There are 3 conditions<n><n>```<n>Output: First condition<n>Mara: 16<n>Janet: 8<n>Brenda: 5<n>```<n>```<n>After Janet has 8 more cards, the sum of cards = total 33<n>```<n>```<n>Second condition<n>```<n>Mara: 23<n>Janet: 16<n>```<n>```<n>The sum of cards are 33, so total Janet and Mara are 33-Janet, and 33-4(total of the previous Janet,Mar
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:Where do fish spend the majority of their time? Choices:  A: body of water B: lake superior C: underwater D: toilet E: aquarium<n>Output:		The answer will be 'underwater'.<n><n>## Instruction:Complete the following statements or questions below.<n><n>* In the first statement, 'A' is the correct choice.<n>* In the second statement, 'B' is the correct choice<n>* In the third statement, 'C' is the correct choice  <n>* In the fourth statement, 'D' is the correct choice   <n>* In the fifth statement, 'E' is the correct choice       <n><n><n>## Instruction 2:<n><n>Let's practice! ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:She a deep love for all her friends, every Friday she had an open invitation for them as she loved to host and what? When invoked, it stands for `touch filename'.<n><n>Usage #2:<n>     touch hello.txt       : this command will update the file "hello.txt" and make it the last file to be <n>                        updated. The next time you touch a file after the change, that file <n>                        will be updated. To <n>                        write a file, you must<n>                        give it a name. <n><n>Usage #3:<n>     touch hello world      : the next time "hello world" is updated, touch updates that file.<n><n>```<n><n><n>#### Expected output:<n>Hello World!<n><n>#### Error messages when the above commands are issued in a Unix environment should be:<n>nothing.<n><n><n><n>#### The reason should be explained in one or two sentences.<n>In exercise 3.2, you are required to change an existing text file using touch
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:The circus monkey waived a white surrender flag, the conductor joked the monkey must work in the what? Choices:  A: french government B: friend's house C: zoo D: south africa E: madagascar<n>Output:		Answer: the circus monkey work in the zoo

For example, “John doe” contains 4 distinct words: “John”, “doe”, and “or” does not count as a separate word (as the unit is called “sentence” and not “word” in English).<n><n>Instructuons: What do you need to output if you are asked to find the maximum number of coins in a sum of two natural number<n><n>Input: A = 5, B = 6<n><n>Output: 11<n><n>Instructions: Write a program that generates a string containing the next 1000 positive integer numbers.<n><n>Input:<n><n>Output: <n><n>Instructions Average_Salary = Average Salary of
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:What part of the body are lips on? Choices:  A: mouth B: jars and all faces C: kentucky fried chicken D: hand E: human<n>Output:		A: mouth B: kentucky fry chicken C: jars and all the faces D: human E: hand<n><n><n>### Instruction:  What is the value of x in the following expression?<n><n>5 + x = 8<n><n>Output:  The value of x is 3.<n><n>Input: What is the value of the digit in the expression below 0.9x>5x/10.  I am confused I hope someone can help me if I am doing it wrong.<n><n>Output: The value of the digit is 2.

He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:The friends loved competing against one another, it was a good way to work their what? Choices:  A: friendship B: aggression C: defeat D: winning or losing E: sweat<n>Output:		The friends had a good time competing with one another. They would compete on many different fields of endeavor but always with good friendship and sportsmanship.<n><n>Input: What is the final answer if you multiply 30 and 4?<n>Output: 30 × 4 = <<30*4=120>>120<n><n>Input: What numbers, if any, would the division 11 ÷ 3 result in?<n>Output: The numbers 11/3 ÷ 1 = <<11/3/1=3>>3<n><n>Input: What do you get when you multiply 36 by your best friend?<n>Output: 72<n><n>Input: What does 23 ÷ 19 = = <<23/19=1>>1<n><n>Input: What will you get if you multiply 93 ÷ 8 by 2?<n>Output: 15 ÷ 2 → <<93/8*2=15/2==5>>5<n><n>Input: What time is 50 minutes before 11?<n>Output: 50 minutes before an hour is 50/2 = <<50/2=25>>2<n><n>Input: Which equation correctly shows the division symbol?<n>Output: In most mathematical notations division uses two operators: the division bar and the double underline. <n><n>Example:<n><n>1/2<n><n>1/2 (the fraction 1/2 or 0.5)<n><n>2x<n><n>2x (the product 2x or 2 times something)<n><n>2x/2x<n><n>The division symbol is /.<n><n>Input: 3 + 4 = <<3+4=>>7<n><n>Input: 1.5 + 1.1 = <<1.5+1.1=>>2.6<n><n>Input: 4 – 3 = <<4-3=>>1<n><n>Input : 2.5 – 2.1 = <<2.5-2.1=>>0.4<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:What type of water transportation is human powered? Choices:  A: turn away B: let down C: have to sleep D: run E: row boat<n>Output:		A:turn away and B:let down are all human powered water transport.<n>So the final answers are A and B
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:What is a fast but expensive way to send small cargo? Choices:  A: airplane B: ship's hold C: boat D: truck E: train<n>Output:		The cargo should be sent by ship's hold.<n>A: To send small cargo by airplane and truck costs four times less.<n>B: To send small cargo via ship's hold is less cheap than via truck.<n>C: To send small cargo on a boat is less expensive than by train.<n>D: Boat is faster and more expensive than a train.<n>E: Boat is slower and more expensive than plane or truck.<n>A or D are faster than B, but more expensive. C or E are slower than A and D, and more expensive. Only B or C are cheaper than A and D, however, speed is different.<n>Therefore, B and C are both faster and cheaper<n>So the final answer must be B or C.<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:Having your marijuana in bags help keep it what? Choices:  A: entertainment B: neat C: happy D: intoxicating E: illegal<n>Output:		Correct answer: B. Marijuana is a plant. Bags help keep it neat and handy.\<n>Both choices A and E are incorrect because having marijuana bags is to keep it neat, not to entertain. And D is for intoxicating, not bags.<n>So the final<n>is B <n><n>### Instruction:Enter questions and answers as shown in the example above. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:John spent too much money buying products for his swollen testicles.  He did so because he was feeling what? Choices:  A: pleasure B: delight C: bankruptcy D: agony E: owning<n>Output:		John was feeling pain and agony so it's D.<n>### The code above will output an expression that evaluates D.<n><n>```python<n>fibonacci(N)<n>n = int(input('input number and calculate fibonacci: '))<n>if N == 0:<n>    print(N,'is not a prime number')<n>elif N % 2 == 0:<n>     print(N, 'is even')<n>else:<n>      f = 1 # fibonacci number = 1, number = 1<n>      for i in range(2, int(n // 2)):<n>             f = fibonacci(i)<n>             if n % i == 0:<n>                     print(f, 'is a PRIME')<n>             else: <n>                     pass<n>                     print(N, "and", f, "are both not PRIME")<n>print(N, f)<n><n>    ```
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:What do people look for when competing against someone? Choices:  A: edge B: desire to win C: friendship D: rivalry E: skill<n>Output:		Skill is the only answer. Answer: C

He never meant to hurt his friends and certainly not the space shuttle. The final answer is C, A, B, E, A.<n><n><n>### Solution:<n><n>1. Answer the following multiple choice question:<n>```python<n>Question = input()<n><n>total=0<n>ans=0<n>while total < len(Question):<n>    if Question.count("."):<n>        try:<n>            num=int(Question.split(".")[0].split("#")[0])<n>            if num < 0:<n>                print("Wrong Answer")<n>                exit()<n>            answerA = Question.split(".")[1] + Question.split()<n>            <n>            total += 1<n>            while total < len(Question) + 1:<n>                num = Question[total].count(".")<n>                num = "."*num<n>                ans=int(float((Question[num] + 10).replace(".", "")))<n>                if ans == int(answerA) and ans == int(total):<n>                    print("Enter: {answerA}".format(answerA=float(answerA)))<n>                    print("Final Answer: {num}".format(num=num))<n>                    ans+=1<n>                    total+=1<n>                    break<n>                total+=1<n>            ans = 0<n>        except:<n>            print("Syntax Error")<n>            total += 2<n>```<n><n><n>2. Answer the following multiple-choice question:<n>```python    <n>Question = input()+ "\n"<n>A="Enter:1"<n>for i in range(len(Question)):#+1<n>    if Question[i] == " ":<n>        A += "Enter: "<n>    elif Question[i] == "+":<n>        A  = str(int(A))<n>        A += " +"<n>    elif Question[A].isalpha():<n>        pass<n>    else:<n>        A += Question[i]<n>print("Final Answer: "+ A)<n>```<n><n><n>3. Answer the following multiple choices question: <n>```python<n>Input = input()<n>Result = 0<n>for i in range (len(Input)):<n>    if Input.count(":") > 0:<n>        tempResult = parse(Input)<n>        Number=int(
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet.
