The others are useless and no one would pick them when legs are tired.<n>So the final word is make mistakes and the final answer is B.<n><n>Input: There are 20 marbles in a jar. They are taken out one by one. A marble taken out has a 1 in 20 chance that it's green and a 19 out of 20 chance that that it is not. Find the chance probability that all the marbles are taken out one by not.<n>Output:(1/20)*(19/20)^(20-1) =<<1/20*(19/20)>>(20-1 ) < <<20-1=80>>80 for the chance probability.<n>So the answer is 80%(199/20) for the chance probability. <n><n>Input: The word, "The word, 'the word, 'the word ', 'the word ','the word ', the word and so on<n>Output: The answer is "the word and so on" since it is the longest word.<n><n>Input: What about that lady who lived in that house that had a rat for a pet? Choices: A. A house is a house is a house. B. She moved to that house, because she loves cats. C. She should get a job. D. She was lonely for a pet. E. She fed it cheese until it died. <n>Output: The answer for the question is C. "She moved to that house, BECAUSE she loves cats,"<n><n>Input: If I throw 10 dice, there is 99% chance that 1 or more dice will be 6's. What is the probability that the total of the 6's is 2 or more?<n>Output: (99*2/100)%(100-2/100)) = <<99*2>>2 times chance probability of choosing 2 or more 6's.<n>The sum is the chance probability after the 2 or more <n>6's, since the other dice are useless and will not work.<n>Therefore, the sum is 99*2/200
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:Where is disease often spread but shouldn't be? Choices:  A: ghost town B: third world country C: human body D: rug E: hospital<n>Output:		Correct answer is C.<n><n><n><n><n><n>

Choices:  A: conquer opponent B: fight enemy C: join army D: kill E: terrible<n>Output:		The answer should be (285 or K) because if you want to fight an army, you have to join an army, otherwise you’re not doing combat.<n><n>Answer:<n>I think the answers should be 285/K.<n><n>A: In war, you have to attack and be attacked by the opposing army, so you need defense as defending is necessary while attacking, or you can just capture the city by doing nothing.<n><n>B: In war, you must make the city in which you live as well as your enemies weak or you won't be able to fight effectively.<n><n>C: War is bad, so you need to prevent it instead of joining an army and you can do so by finding an alliance between you and other countries.<n><n>D: War is bad, you need to fight in order to prevent the enemy from attacking.<n><n>E: War is a big waste of time, so you don't want a bad city if you want to fight.<n><n>Given: A war general has built a castle. How far has the war general traveled?<n>Answer:The war generals traveled 15 miles to the northwestern castle.<n>Also, he traveled from the castle to the war general and traveled that much again. 15+15 = << 15+126 = 141 >>>141 miles. So the final answer is 141.<n><n>Given 1: Tom is 17 years old. Tom’s father is 5 times more than Tom’s age. How old is Tom’s father?<n>Answer:Given that Tom is 17 and his father is five times as old, then Toms age is five times greater than that of his fathers and 5 times 17 = <<5*17=85>>85.<n>Then the father's age is 17+85 = <<17+85=102 >>> 1

Choices:  A: diary B: city C: bible D: graffiti E: labyrinth<n>Output:		A: diary B B B D<n>A diary is a written record. A passage is a group of sentences.<n>A book is a written record, too. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. What is their likely goal?Choices:  A: attractiveness B: pleasure C: compliments D, joy E: interesting experiences<n>Output:C. Compliments.<n>Make-up: it gives compliments, it makes you feel attractive and you can tell the world that they are admiring it.<n><n>Output:C.<n><n>Output:None of the above<n><n><n>### Notes (Solution):<n><n>### Q01.(A)<n><n>```python<n># Definition for a Node.<n>class Node:<n>    def __init__(self, val):<n>        self.val = val<n>        self.left = None<n>        self.right = None<n>```<n><n>```python<n>def countNodes(node):<n>    if node == None:<n>        return 0<n>    return 1 + countNodes(node.left) + countNodes(node..right)<n>```<n><n>```<n>Runtime: 400 ms, faster than 91.99% of Pycharm<n>Memory Usage: 16.5 MB, less than 6.49% of 91.91 in Python-33.<n>```<n><n>#### Q02:<n><n>```java<n>package Main;<n><n>public class Main {<n>    public static void main(String[] args) {<n>       input++;<n>             System.out.println("Input: Janet has " + input +<n>       " cards more than Brenda.\n"+<n>       "Mara has twice as many cards than Janet.\n"+<n>       "# Janet \n"+<n>       "# has " + input + "cards" + "\n"+<n>       "# and " + (input/2) + "cards" +<n>       "\n# and " + (input - 82) + "cards " +<n>       "\n"+<n>       "Janet " +<n>       ((input)/2) + " " +<n>       "cards\n"<n>                  +<n>                  "Brenda and " +<n>                  (input-9)+" cards\n";<n><n>       input++;<n>   //    input++;<n>       System.out.println(Q1a);<n><n><n>    }<n>}<n>```<n><n>### A2Q03:<n><n>```Python<n>

A: 751 B: 2501 C: 5001 D: 1501<n>Output: The range is from 1 to 1000 (1000-1 = <<1000-<1>>0), so there are at least 750 girls. 2/3 of 2501, or 750, is 2501 – 750 = <<2501-<2501>>0 (since each girl is assigned a number).  So there are at least 2501 girls. (<<750+2501>>1,2501 ≥ 1000)<n><n>Output: B

How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:Why shouldn't you walk barefooted after the rain? If the answer is "No", the computer should add (input length)-1 to the same value of the input.<n><n>Input: Choices:  A-BE-D<n>Result: 3<n><n>Input:B-CE-D<n>Result: -3<n><n>Input:Choices:  A-B-C<n>Result: -1<n><n>Input:A-BE-A<n>Result: 3+1<n><n>Input:E-A-D<n>Result: (7-1)+1-5=3<n><n>### Instruction:<n><n>Programming Language: Python.<n><n>Time Limit: 1 sec.<n><n>Memory Limit: 15MB.<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:The doctor recommended washing hands, what was being promoted? Choices:  A: cold hands B: wet floor C: health D: become wet E: dry skin<n>Output:		Warm hands<n><n><p align="center"><n><img src="/assets/img/2022-02-01-173712.png" width="600"><n></p>

At the time, it had been five hundred years since that story had last been told in Greek—the language of the original scriptures. So for accuracy, Lutf Uller went to the Greek scholars who had the originals and asked them how to write the Greek letters and words that made up this ancient story. They told him that he could use the alphabet as it is today, and their Latin transliterations of the Greek letters for the words. They did suggest some changes, however. He was to use the letter Γ for God and not for the Greek letter gamma; the Roman Catholic scholar Petrus Galatinus would make this change in Latin as well. He was to put an acute accent over the second e in Jesus, and he was to omit the e at the end of Christ. If you use those two changes, then, the Greek word for Jesus is Î¢ÏŽÏƒÎ¹ÎºÎ¿Ï. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:Billy's mother tripped over a stuffed animal.  She yelled at him not to leave his things where? Choices:  A: toy store B: hall C: bathroom D: amusement park E: fairgrounds<n>Output:		Choice A <<A: toy store>> because toy stores keep toys. So he would leave it there.<n><n><n>### Solution:<n><n>![](solutions/solutions.png)<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. Choices:  A: being ordered B: less confusion C: boredom D: standing in line E: have to wait for<n>Output:		Having to wait line in the store line.<n><n>Input:What's the largest number that would fit in the square made by the dots?<n>Output:(5 × 5) + 1 = <<5*5>+1=71>>7<n><n>Input:What’s half of this number? 000203111222233444 (or)<n>Output: 000256(or)<n><n>Input:What is the sum of 1 and 100000 if you can only add with one digit numbers?<n>Output: 110(or)<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>Input:Janet has 9 cards less than Brenda. Mar a has twice as many cards than Janet. How many card's do they have in all?<n><n>Answer: Here I am going to solve the question, by using a method which is known as **Indirect way to solve a question which needs both sides to be equal.**<n><n>In this problem, Janet has less than Brenda. Hence Brenda has more than Janet. So if Brenda has 1 card less, it means that Janet has 1 card less than Brenda.<n>So far we got only 2 clues<n><n>Since Janet has 11.<n><n>The problem is to find How much are their cards.<n><n>So let us form some equations. <n><n>Let us form the equations which we get from our clues.<n>Janet has less than Branda is<n><n>A₁ = B₁ + 1<n><n>i.e.,<n><n>Janet has 9.<n><n>So Brenda has<n><n>B₁ = 9-1 =8<n><n>Mara has twice as many cards<n><n>B₁ = B₂<n><n>i.e<n><n>B₂ = 2B₁<n><n>i.e.<n><n>9-1 =8 and 2×8 =16<n><n>Since 9-1 = 8, 9 can be easily deduced. So 9=16.<n><n>Mara has 150- 40=1120.<n><n>Again,<n><n>B₁ = N-K<n><n>B₂ = M-H<n><n>i.e..<n><n>H ≠ M<n>since we have
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:Which long saga will we be watching on tonight's program? Choices:  A: concert B: opera C: theater D: take class E: television<n>Output:		The program is a theater performance. The other choices are television, concert, opera, and class.<n>So the final choice is D: theater<n>

How many dollars do they all have in all?<n>Output<<2x8=16>>16 + 16 = <<16+16=32>>32 -1<n><n>Input: 100<n>Output: 100 + 25 + 15<n><n>Input: 71<n>Output: 71 + 25 +15 + 10<n><n>Input: 50<n>Output: 50 + 25<n><n>Input:100<n>Output<<100+50>>100 + 46 = 100 + ((24/2) = 3 <b>24/2=12">)2 = 57<n><n>Input:5<n>Output<<5+(16-5)>>5 + 11 = 5 + 11=16<n><n>Input:5-2 +1<n>Output<<5 - 2 + 1>>5 - 3 <b>5-2=3">3 + 1 = 4<n><n>Input:3<n>Output<<3+(3+1)>>3 + 3 + 1= 7<n><n>Input:N + n1<3<n>Output<< N + n1 < 6>>N + 6 < 9<n><n>Input:n1<4<n>Output<< n1< 5>> n2 < 10<n><n>Output: B<n><n>Input:50<n>Output<<2*50>>10(3) = 30 + 10 = 40<n><n>Input:3 + 3<n>Output<<3(1) + 3>>3 + 3 = 6<n><n>Input:4<n>Output<< 4(3)>>4 + 12 = 16<n><n>Output: A<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:What is someone likely to feel after receiving a gift that is not common? Choices:  A: special B: personal C: offended D: unique E: rare<n>Output:		Choice: A is the correct answer since a gift that is not a common type of gift such as clothing or flowers is likely to be special to the person who receives it.<n>Choice: B is the incorrect answer since it refers to a type of gift, not how the receiver feels.<n>Choice: C is the incorrect answer since no gift is meant to offend someone.<n>Choice: D is the incorrect answer since the gift may be special, unique, or rare depending on the type of gift.<n>Choice: E is the incorrect answer since a gift is likely to be rare since it is not a common type.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the questions below.<n><n>**(A)** Which of the following is an addition expression with the number 5? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. Choices:  A: happiness B: sore muscles C: injury D: perfection E: errors<n>Output:		The correct answer is a)happiness. This is the most frequent.<n><n>The Stat for Baseball<n><n>Clean hits and clean catches are a good things to happen in a baseball game. If they do not it's not necessarily a bad thing.<n><n>Batting %: An at-bat doesn't always result in a hit.<n><n>A Bunt: Not enough for a hit, but it gets the ball in play.<n><n>A pop-up: Nothing to write home about.<n><n>An out: Not good, but necessary in a sport where it is so easy to hit a home run.<n><n>A Homerun: Best possible outcome,  not only does it allow you to get the desired number of runs on base, it allows you to add to your home run record, one of the more difficult records to achieve.<n><n><n><n>Input:How much is 15800-21650? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. Choices:  A: builders B: driver C: architect D: fall down E: tradesmen<n>Output:		D, but only after D1,D2<n>1#1: The architect designs a building before building actually begins.<n>2#2: The builder builds the building before it's actually finished.<n>3#3: The architect designs a finished building as he completes each stage of a building's construction.<n><n>1#1 #3<n>2#2 #3<n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:A person who wants to make more at their job but can't will often need to find a what? Choices:  A: own house B: better job C: win lottery D: save money E: feel safe<n>Output:		The final answer is <<B>>B.<n>A person who wants to learn more at their job will often need to find A: a house or an apartment.<n>A person who saves for a rainy day will often need to find B: a better job.<n>A lottery gives a person the chance, at very little cost, to win a large amount of money. As a result, it does not help a person to improve the quality of their life in any realistic way.<n><n># Problem 1<n># Input: 5612<n># Output: 1256<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. He rode the bus 20 blocks to the post office to get some stamps. Later, he came home the same way. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:Where would you find fungus growing on something made from milk? Choices:  A: eyes B: biology laboratory C: shower stall D: old cheese E: decaying matter<n>Output:		The answer is <<E: Decaying matter >><n><n>Input:Which of these birds do not make a nest? Choices: A: stork B: tern C: owl D: quail E: hummingbird F: gannet<n>Output: The answer <n>is <<D: Quail >><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda. Mara has twice as many cards as Janet. How many cards do they have in all if Mara has 40 cards less than 150?<n>Output: Mara has 150 - 40 = <<150-40=110>>110 cards.<n>Janet has 110/2 = <<110/2=55>>55 cards since Mara has twice as many as Janet.<n>Brenda has 55 - 9 = <<55-9=46>>46 cards since Janet has 9 cards more than Brenda.<n>Therefore, they all have 110 + 55 + 46 = <<110+55+46=211>>211 cards.<n>So the final answer is 211<n><n>Input: Pete walked 5 blocks from his house to the bus garage in Houston. How many blocks did Pete travel in all?<n>Output: The number of blocks traveled on the way to the post office was 5 + 20 = <<5+20=25>>25.<n>Pete traveled 25 × 2 = <<25*2=50>>50 blocks in all.<n>So the final answer is 50<n><n>Input:It was breakfast time.  Brad ordered eggs, toast, and something to drink. What might he drink? Choices:  A: coffee B: throw up C: food D: getting drunk E: wine<n>Output:		Brad ordered egg, toast and something to drink.<n>Options are: A, B, C, D, and E are not options, because eggs, toast, coffee, throw up, food, getting drunk and wine are the only acceptable answer for Brad. So the final answer is  food<n><n>Input: On Sunday, I went to church and got really bad headache.  Then I went to the store to get a headache pill. Then I came home and tried to relax.  Then my friend called me and asked me to go kite fly somewhere.  So I went and then I flew a kite.  And then it flew so high that it broke my string. and when string broke, the kite fell to the ground.  Then I came home and I had very bad headache.  On Monday, I got up early in the morning and I went to work.  When I got to work I had to take out 5 boxes. So I got all 5 boxes.  Then I took the boxes to the mail room.  Then I walked down the stair case.  Then I had to take two elevators. Then I got to the mailroom.  I put the boxes on the table.  Then I ran back to my desk.  At my desk, I got coffee.  I opened the coffee and poured the coffee.  So I had 1 cup of coffee.  Then I took my coffee and ran back to the mailroom.I took all the boxes.  Then I went up the elevators. Then down the staircase.  I got to my desk. I closed the coffee.  I put it in a cabinet.  Then I took out a folder.  I opened it and I put the boxes in the folder.  It has 5 boxes.  The folder has a handle and it was pink.  The folder looked old kind of.  Then I closed the folder.  Then I put the coffee in the cabinet.  Then I went back to the mailroom and got my box.  So I took all the boxes and I got on the elevators and I went down to the 12th floor.  I got off the elevator.  There is a box on the floor and there is a girl with purple skirt and a yellow sweater and green scarf and hair with braid.  Then I picked up the box.
